page.title: 01Welsh Border W of Shrewsbury
page.content: This is a farming community situated south of the River Severn and on the Welsh Border. Most of the farmland is grassland where cattle, both dairy and beef animals, are raised and secondarily sheep are raised sheep are raised. A good proportion of fields are used for crops, the main ones being wheat, barley, sugar beet & potatoes. The NW corner of the area is hill (Bausley Hill) approximately 200 metres ASL. The NE corner contains most of the village of Alberbury with the largest population of the area and also the country house Loton Park belonging to Sir Michael Leighton with the Deer Park containing about 250 deer (fallow). The farms are mainly owner farmed but a good number are tennant farmed.
